Add assertions to Duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke currently does not use any assertions. (Only exception handling)

Let's,
* Edit the build.gradle file to enable assertions
* Add an assertion to getResponse in Duke.java to ensure that Duke
never returns a blank response
* Add an assertion to addTask in TaskList.java to check that no
non-adding commands will call that method

Assertions help to catch mistakes made in the code rather than by the
user, so this will help to improve the overall quality of the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify code to comply with Code Quality standards
commitResults.messageBody:
The code amongst all classes violates many code quality standards,
such as use of magic literals, lack of SLAP and long functions.

By fixing these code quality errors, it will be easier for others
(and myself) to quickly and better understand what the code is doing
at any given point.

Let's
* Replace all magic literals with constants with descriptive names.
* Abstract out code in functions to satisfy SLAP and reduce length of
  functions.
* Add meaningful comments to explain the why/what of code, and remove
comments that explain the how.
* Add guard clauses to certain functions to make the happy path clearer.

This will hopefully greatly reduce the amount of code quality violations
and make it much easier to understand and read.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve find command to be case insensitive
commitResults.messageBody:
Find command is case sensitive.

If the user enters a key phrase, the find command only returns
tasks that fit the phrase exactly. (e.g. find book does not return
the task Return Book)

Let's change containsPhrase method in Task to be case insensitive.

This will solve the aforementioned problem of case sensitive keyphrases.

Note: This commit is made on this branch so that I can create a pull
request for branch-A-Streams, since my code already uses streams
and hence was identical to the master branch.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove text ui tests
Set up Continuous Integration
Add ability to specify command shortcuts
commitResults.messageBody:
Users can only use the commands specified in the program.

Adding the ability for users to specify their own shortcuts
(or aliases) for commands will improve the user's workflow by
making the syntax more friendly overall.

Let's
* Add a class to handle aliases
* Add methods to save and load aliases to and from a config file
* Modify certain methods in TaskList to take into consideration
aliases of variable length

Having a dedicated class to handle aliases will ensure that
other classes would not get too long, as well as serving as
an encapsulation of alias-related functionality so that any
future modifications made to how aliases are handled will
not cause a cascade of modifications in other classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Result class to project
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the execute method for all commands returns a TaskList
object.

This is a sign of inadequate abstraction, as it does not make much
logical sense for all commands to return a task list, especially for
alias-related commands that do not modify the task list. In addition,
AliasHandler and TaskList currently contain a message attribute to
store the output message, which is a potential sign of repeated code.

Let's,
* create a new class, Result, that stores an AliasHandler object and
TaskList object, as well as an output message string.
* make all commands return Result instead of TaskList.
* remove the message attribute from TaskList and AliasHandler.

This would provide another layer of abstraction, as well as making
the code easier to understand. (The return value of executing a
Command is a Result.) It also reduces code duplication, as
there is now only one message attribute. (In Result)
